title: Record-breaking downpour sweeps cars to sea in southern Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: Flash flooding along Victoria's Great Ocean Road has seen caravan parks inundated and cars swept to sea after thunderstorms and torrential rain battered the southern coast. Footage posted to social media shows up to three cars being swept to sea by floodwaters in Wye River, and one resident said weather-related damage had isolated them on their property. Separate social media clips show caravans being inundated by the Erskine River in Lorne, where the only supermarket was forced to close until further notice. SES crews are assessing the extent of flooding there. title: Trump says he's been told execution of protesters in Iran will subside | ABC NEWS
description: *WARNING: This story contains distressing images of people who are deceased.* Some troops stationed at a major US air base in Qatar have been evacuated amid heightened tensions with Iran. It comes after Iran's judiciary defied US warnings not to execute protesters, saying those arrested could still be tried and killed.  00: 00 US President Donald Trump said he had been told that killings of protesters were subsiding and that he believed there was no plan for large-scale executions, but has not ruled out military action against Tehran. 02:25 Middle East Correspondent Matthew Doran looks at what Donald Trump's next action could be, and how the region is preparing themselves for a potential US military strike. title: Randa Abdel-Fattah invited to 2027 Writers' Week as board overturns decision | ABC NEWS
description: The Adelaide Festival Corporation has apologised to author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.  The 2026 event was cancelled when more than 180 participants boycotted after the Palestinian-Australian author was dumped from the line-up. In a social media post, Randa Abdel-Fattah says she accepts the apology and would consider the invitation to participate in 2027 "at the appropriate time". title: Greenland talks in US fail to reach 'acceptable' result | ABC NEWS
description: Denmark says it has "agreed to disagree" with the United States over the future of Greenland, but repeated that a US takeover of the territory is "totally unacceptable".  Greenland, the world's largest island, is a semi-autonomous territory of Denmark with a population of about 57,000 people. Its location between Russia and North America makes it extremely strategically important to the US.   ðŸŽ¥ Video by Lia Walsh   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Government's hate crime and gun control bill gets pushback from other parties | ABC NEWS
description: The Greens will not support the government's sweeping changes to hate and gun laws without significant amendments, including the broadening of protections to all minority groups.   Opposition Leader Sussan Ley labelled the government's laws "unsalvageable", in a signal the Liberal Party is preparing to vote against the bill. title: Documents reveal tensions over Kunanyi/Mt Wellington access plans debate | ABC NEWS
description: When the Tasmanian government launched a review into Kunanyi/Mt Wellington in 2024, opponents saw it as an attempt to revive the divisive debate about building a cable car to the summit.  As the review progresses, those concerns have continued to grow, with documents showing the Wellington Park Management Trust arguing mountain access issues have been exaggerated by the government, and 'all-weather' solutions could pose safety risks for visitors. title: Farm workers chase $260,000 in upaid wages, some from major supermarket suppliers | ABC NEWS
description: "Heartbroken" workers at a company that supplies Coles and Woolworths say they have not been paid for 100 hours of work they did in the 2023 pre-Christmas rush. Liquidators are investigating large cash withdrawals from the group of companies and allege systemic tax fraud. title: From inside Iran a young protester says the people 'are waiting for America to intervene' | ABC NEWS
description: From inside Iran, a defiant voice has bravely broken through the internet blackout to detail the horrors she has witnessed and to tell the president of the United States "the people are waiting for America to intervene".  Iranian protester Sarah says Iran's regime wants to break her will and fears they could kill her.   But like many other young Iranians, she's willing to risk her life for a better Iran.  After days of no communication with the outside world, this savvy, educated woman from Tehran, whose real name we are concealing for safety reasons, has made contact with the ABC.  ðŸŽ¤Nassim Khadem ðŸŽ¬Seena Katayama  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Trump team divided by factions over Greenland dispute | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump seems undeterred by talks between Denmark and the United States as he pursues his goal to take over the strategic territory of Greenland. title: Widows in Kenya fight to keep their homes | The World | ABC NEWS
description: In Kenya, women who have lost their husbands often face cultural pressure to give up their inheritance, which can lead to a cycle of poverty for widows and their children. Advocates are trying to change that, hoping to pass a bill that would provide legal aid to women fighting to keep their homes. Rebecca Johnston reports. title: Author threatens defamation action against SA premier | ABC NEWS
description: The South Australian premier has been threatened with defamation proceedings over comments he made about a writer whose appearance at Adelaide Writersâ€™ Week was cancelled. Peter Malinauskas says his remarks are on the public record and people will see that they're founded in a place of compassion.  The 2026 Writers' Week was cancelled after more than 180 authors and participants withdrew from the event. The Adelaide Festival Corporation has since apologised to author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.
